definition: Wang Mang (45 BC-23 AD), usurped power and reigned 9-23 between the former and later Han
surname Wang
king or monarch/best or strongest of its type/grand/great
to rule/to reign over
thick weeds/luxuriant growth/Illicium anisatum, a shrub with poisonous leaves/impertinent

sentences.english: Xiu Han Dynasty by Wang Mang to kill this golden rooster lead the way by which name.
sentences.chinese: 因西汉末年刘秀遭王莽追杀到此金鸡引路而名。

sentences.english: Low temperatures and droughts reached their climax during Wang Mang's reign (9-23 CE).
sentences.chinese: 王莽时代低温和旱灾达到高峰。
这对王莽是极不公平的。

sentences.english: The dynasty lasted more than two hundred years until Wang Mang usurped the throne of Emperor Xiao Ping.
sentences.chinese: 汉朝历时两百余年，到了孝平皇帝，被王莽篡了位。

sentences.english: Someone asked him, "What do you think of Wang Mang's physiognomy?"
sentences.chinese: 有人就问他王莽的相貌好不好？

sentences.english: At the end of the Western Han dynasty, Wang Mang usurped the throne and made himself King.
sentences.chinese: 西汉末年，有个篡汉自立为帝的王莽。

sentences.english: Wang Mang was a controversial figure in the Chinese history.
sentences.chinese: 王莽在中国历史上一直是一个颇有争议的人物。

sentences.english: Liu bang from _ the uprising to WangMang reigned han dynasty, across two hundred DuoNian of time and space.
sentences.chinese: 从_刘邦起义反秦到王莽篡汉，横跨二百多年时空。

definition: to usurp political power
Qin Ershi (229-207 BC), second Qin emperor
posthumous name of the first Han emperor Liu Bang 劉邦|刘邦 (256 or 247-195 BC), reigned 202-195 BC
the Xin dynasty (8-23 AD) of Wang Mang 王莽, forming the interregnum between the former and later Han
Emperor Xuan (91-48 BC) of the Former Han Dynasty, reigned 74-48 BC
Emperor Wen of Han (202-157 BC), fourth Han emperor, personal name Liu Heng 劉恆|刘恒[Liu2 Heng2], reigned 180-157 BC
to make a new start/to regenerate
Sima Yan (236-290), founding emperor of Jin dynasty 晋 after the Three Kingdoms period, reigned 265-290 as Emperor Wu of Jin 晉武帝
Red Eyebrows, rebel group involved in the overthrow of the Xin dynasty 新朝[Xin1 chao2]
the Northern Zhou Dynasty (557-581)/one of the Northern Dynasties
Western Han Dynasty (206 BC-8 AD), also called 前漢|前汉[Qian2 Han4], Former Han Dynasty
Emperor Gaozu of Tang, reign name of first Tang emperor Li Yuan 李淵|李渊[Li3 Yuan1] (566-635), reigned 618-626
Fu Jian (338-385), emperor of Former Qin 前秦[Qian2 Qin2], reigning from 357-385
Former Qin of the Sixteen Kingdoms (351-395)
Later Han or Eastern Han dynasty (25-220)/Later Han of the Five Dynasties (947-950)
Eastern or later Han dynasty, 25-220
